Secs. 5-124-5-175. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE III. - DEANNEXATIONS[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Charter reference- For description of original boundaries, § 1.2; for method of extending boundaries, § 1.03. 
State Law reference- Maps of city to be filed in office of city secretary and changes noted thereon, V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 41.001. 

Sec. 5-176. - Deannexation number one. 
(a)  Designation of territory. The following uninhabited territory now included and lying within the corporate limits of the city situated in the Henry Scott League, Abstract 83, in Fort Bend County, Texas, and described by metes and bounds as follows: 
Beginning at a point and corner in the existing city limit boundary of the City of Rosenberg, being in the northwest line of U.S. Highway 59 and the southeast line of the N. Y. T. & M. RR right-of-way, and said point of beginning being at the point of intersection of the west line of Tract 27 of Rosenberg Farms Subdivision projected northerly, with said northwest line of U.S. Highway 59, and a plat of which Rosenberg Farms Subdivision appears recorded in Book 4, page 25, of the map records of Fort Bend County, Texas, to which refer; 
Thence northeasterly along the northwest right-of-way line of said U.S. Highway 59 and existing city limit line, approximately 1,500 feet to a point for corner where the centerline of Bamore Road extended northerly intersects said northwest line of U.S. Highway 59; 
Thence northerly along said existing city limit line and said extension of the centerline of Bamore Road 700 feet, more or less, to a point in the underpass under the G. H. & S. A. or T. & N. O. Railway for corner, said corner being in the center of the right-of-way of said railway and also the centerline of State Highway 36; 
Thence N 27°24' W, 583.8 feet along said existing city limit line to a point in the right-of-way of said State Highway 36; 
Thence N 38°29' W along said existing city limit line 400 feet, more or less, to a point in the northeast right-of-way line of said State Highway 36 for the most northerly corner of the area here described; 
Thence southeasterly first along the northeasterly line of State Highway 36 and continuing along the northerly line of U.S. Highway 90-A, 2,100 feet, more or less, to a point in the northerly line of U.S. Highway 90-A and 59, said point being where the east line of Lot 8, Block 2, of Highway Addition, a subdivision of land in said City of Rosenberg, projected northerly, intersects said northerly line of said highways; 
Thence south, crossing said highways to a point in the south line of said U.S. Highway 90-A and 59, said point being the northeast corner of said Lot 8, Block 2, Highway Addition; 
Thence westerly and turning southwesterly along a curve to the left following first the southerly line of said U.S. Highway 59 and then the southeasterly line of said highway, 2,400 feet, more or less, to a point in the existing city limit line of said City of Rosenberg, said point being where the west line of Tract 27 of said Rosenberg Farms Subdivision intersects the southeasterly line of said U.S. Highway 59; 
Thence north, crossing said highway along the existing city limit line to the place of beginning, and containing twelve (12) acres of land, more or less, is hereby discontinued as a part of the City of Rosenberg, and the corporate boundaries of said city are contracted so as to no longer include the territory hereinabove described and the same is hereby disannexed from and shall cease to be a part of said city. 
(b)  Liability for debts. Such territory hereby discontinued as a part of the city shall be liable for its pro rata share of any debts incurred while such area was a part of the city, and the city shall continue to levy, assess and collect taxes on the taxable property within such territory to pay the indebtedness incurred while such area was a part of the city as though the same had not been excluded from the boundaries of the city. 
(Code 1960, § 1-26) 
Sec. 5-177. - Deannexation number two. 
(a)  Designation of territory. The below described tract of land, comprising 3.24 acres, more or less, is hereby disannexed and discontinued from the corporate limits of the City of Rosenberg, Texas. Said tract of land hereby disannexed and discontinued from the City of Rosenberg, Texas, is more particularly described by metes and bounds below: 
BEGINNING at a point in the south right-of-way line of State Highway 36 at the northwest corner of the existing City Limits of the City of Rosenberg as described in Ordinance Number 97-23, being a 116.91 acre tract, for the northwest corner and Place of Beginning of the herein described 3.24 acre tract; 
THENCE South 73° 09' 53? East along the south right-of-way line of State Highway 36, same being the City Limits line of the City of Rosenberg, 280.80 feet to a point for the northeast corner of the herein described tract, said point being located North 73° 09' 53? West, 916.90 feet from the point of intersection of the south right-of-way line of State Highway 36, same being the City Limits line of City of Rosenberg, with the common line of the Yandell Ferris Survey, Abstract 376, and the Nancy Spencer Survey, Abstract 88, said point further being located North 73° 09' 53? West, 3,671.41 feet from a Texas Department of Transportation Disc set in concrete at an angle point in south right-of-way line of State Highway 36; 
THENCE South 02° 40' 27? West, 398.43 feet to a point in the centerline of a ditch for the southeast corner of the herein described tract; 
THENCE North 84° 03' 30? West along the centerline of said ditch, 385.22 feet to the point of intersection of said ditch with the most westerly line of the City Limits of the City of Rosenberg for the southwest corner of the herein described tract; 
THENCE North 16° 50' 07? East along the existing City Limits line of the City of Rosenberg, 459.12 feet to the Place of Beginning and containing 3.24 acres of land, more or less. 
(Ord. No. 2008-49, § 2, 12-2-08) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2008-49, § 2, adopted Dec. 2, 2008, did not specifically amend the Code; hence, inclusion herein as § 5-177 was at the discretion of the editor. See also the Code Comparative Table. 
Sec. 5-178. - Deannexation number three. 
    Section 1. The above findings are hereby incorporated for all purposes as if each word was set out herein; the petition for disannexation is attached hereto as Exhibit "A" and is hereby incorporated for all purposes as if it were set out fully herein; and, the map of the territory to be disannexation is attached hereto as Exhibit "B" and is hereby incorporated for all purposes as if it were set out fully herein. 
    Section 2. As of the effective date of this Ordinance, the land and territory shown on Exhibit "B" is hereby disannexed from the corporate limits of the City of Rosenberg, Texas, and said territory as described shall hereafter be removed from the boundary limits of said City, and the present boundary limits of said City are altered and amended so as to remove the territory from the corporate limits of the City of Rosenberg, Texas. 
    Section 3. The City Council hereby finds and determines that the property herein disannexed should be excluded from Council District No. 4 and, in this regard, hereby approves the exclusion of such tract and parcel of property from Council District No. 4, and directs that the City's official map depicting the boundaries of the City's four (4) single-member district be modified, amended, and redrawn to reflect such exclusion. 
    Section 4. As of the effective date of this Ordinance, the land and territory so described and so amended shall no longer be part of the City of Rosenberg, Texas and the land and territory shall no longer bear any of the taxes levied by the City of Rosenberg, Texas and the future inhabitants thereof shall no longer be entitled to any rights or privileges as citizens; nor shall they be bound by the acts, ordinances, resolutions, and regulations of the City of Rosenberg, Texas, as such shall be limited in application to the citizens and corporate limits of said City. 
    Section 5. The City Secretary be, and she is hereby, authorized and directed to forthwith cause a certified copy of this Ordinance to be delivered to the County Clerk of Fort Bend County, Texas, as required by § 41.0015, Texas Local Government Code. 


Exhibit A

Commencing at a 3/4 inch iron rod with cap marked "EHR&A" found in the northwesterly right-of-way line of Berdett Road for the south corner of said called 371.8877 acre tract, said point also being in the southwest line of said Wiley Martin Survey, Abstract 56, same being the northeast line of the adjoining Henry Wilcox Survey, Abstract 342, and the northeast line of an adjoining called 607.75 acre tract recorded in Volume 64, Page 109, Deed Records, Fort Bend County, Texas;

Sec. 5-179. - Deannexation number four. 
    Section 1. The above findings are hereby incorporated for all purposes as if each word was set out herein; the petition for dis-annexation is attached hereto as Exhibit "A" and is hereby incorporated for all purposes as if it were set out fully herein. 
    Section 2. As of the effective date of this Ordinance, the land and territory shown on Exhibit "B" is hereby dis-annexed from the corporate limits of the City of Rosenberg, Texas, and said territory as described shall hereafter be removed from the boundary limits of said City, and the present boundary limits of said City are altered and amended so as to remove the territory from the corporate limits of the City of Rosenberg, Texas. 
    Section 3. The City Council hereby finds and determines that the property herein dis-annexed should be excluded from Council District No. 4 and, in this regard, hereby approves the exclusion of such tract and parcel of property from Council District No. 4, and directs that the City's official map depicting the boundaries of the City's four (4) single-member district be modified, amended, and redrawn to reflect such exclusion. 
    Section 4. As of the effective date of this Ordinance, the land and territory so described and so amended shall no longer be part of the City of Rosenberg, Texas, and the land and territory shall no longer bear any of the taxes levied by the City of Rosenberg, Texas, and the future inhabitants thereof shall no longer be entitled to any rights or privileges as citizens; nor shall they be bound by the acts, ordinances, resolutions, and regulations of the City of Rosenberg, Texas, as such shall be limited in application to the citizens and corporate limits of said City. 
    Section 5. The City Secretary be, and she is hereby, authorized and directed to forthwith cause a certified copy of this Ordinance to be delivered to the County Clerk of Fort Bend County, Texas, as required by § 41.0015, TEXAS LOCAL GOVERNMENT CODE. 
    Section 6. This Ordinance is not severable. 
    Section 7. This Ordinance shall be effective immediately from and after passage. 
    PASSED AND APPROVED by a vote of 7 "ayes" in favor and 0 "noes" against on this first and final reading in full compliance with the provisions of Section 3.10 of the Charter of the City of Rosenberg on the 21st day of July 2015.
